climbs.name: Northeast Spur (PD+)
climbs.fa: Dick Chambers, Roy Mason, C. Scott, Paddy Sherman, 1957

content.description:
From Kevin McLane's 'Alpine Select': 
  
 This is the ever-popular normal route to the summit, directly up from the Joffre-Matier col. The difficulties are mainly on the 45 degree snow apron below the rock, many different lines can be taken 1-1.5 h from upper Matier glacier. Descend via the route.

Axe, crampons, pickets/screws depending on conditions.

From Kevin McLane's 'Alpine Select': 
  
 This is the highest peak in the Joffre group, an attractive and deservedly popular mountain which offers a fine panorama in all directions from its summit. Matier offers a variety of climbs, all of which involve glacial approaches and descents, and most of which are modest in difficulty. Each side of the mountain is protected by glaciers, although only those on the south side are particularly steep. The normal route up the Northeast Face can be done as a car-to-car day trip by a fit party.
